requirements: Certified copy of parent/guardian ID (if under 16)
process: Visit your nearest Department of Home Affairs office.
Complete the ID application form (Form BI-9).
Submit your documents to a DHA official.
Biometric data (photo, fingerprints) will be taken.
Receive a receipt and wait for notification when your ID is ready.
id_application.online_services: You can apply online at https://ehome.dha.gov.za/ehomeaffairs

process: Report the birth at a Home Affairs office or hospital.
A birth certificate is issued free of charge if registered within 30 days.
birth_certificate.duration: Same day or up to 8 weeks (if late registration).
birth_certificate.online_services: Currently not available online. Must visit a DHA office.

process: Book an appointment with a registered marriage officer.
Submit completed marriage form and required IDs.
Marriage certificate issued on the same day.
marriage_certificate.duration: Issued on the same day if all documents are correct.
marriage_certificate.online_services: Not available online. Must be done at a DHA office or by a registered marriage officer.

requirements: Doctor’s or nurse’s confirmation of death
process: Obtain a notification of death form from the hospital or doctor.
Submit the form and the deceased's ID at the Home Affairs office.
Death certificate is processed and issued.
death_certificate.duration: Usually issued on the same day.
death_certificate.online_services: Not available online. Must visit a DHA office.
